text: hi guys I don't often make yeasted dough
on this show but today I'm going to
because I really wanted to make this
recipe and it's a cinnamon nut bun and
it uses a really simple yeast dough to
start off with so I figured you know
what I'm just gonna make it start off by
stirring 1/4 cup of warm water into two
packages of yeast to just let it sit for
about 5 minutes while you're waiting you
can bind your other ingredients this is
1/2 a cup of butter 1 stick unsalted add
1 and 1/2 cups of milk this is warm but
not hot
we usually say about 115 degrees is good
to that you can add 1/4 cup of sugar 2
large eggs so then then at 2 and 1/4
teaspoons of coarse salt and then you
can add your yeast mixture add yeast and
then you just stir in your flour it's 6
cups of all-purpose flour no mixers
needed you can knead this by hand you
could use a standing mixer if you have
one with a dough hook and then just
knead it right in the mixer but I like
to do it by hand you're looking for here
is kind of a shaggy dough it's a little
bit sticky and that's okay because now
you're gonna need it right now it's
super sticky but the kneading and then
the subsequent rising will take away a
lot of that stickiness start off using a
pretty generous amount of flour have a
nice big bowl and some softened butter
you can see that it's already not really
sticking to my hands anymore and it's
springy and smooth I feel like done so
I'm just gonna put it in the bowl to
rise brush the bowl with butter this
keeps your dough from sticking to the
bowl I like to put my dough in top side
down just turn it around once wash it
around a little bit just to the top has
some butter on it so it doesn't dry out
and then additionally cover it with
plastic wrap and then just put it
someplace warm
and let it rise until it's doubled in
bulk that'll take about an hour and 15
minutes it's risen and beautiful the
miracle of yeast I'm going to make my
filling now I have a cup of dark brown
sugar in my food processor to that I'm
adding 2/3 of a cup of pecans
then add a half a cup of chocolate chips
1/2 a teaspoon of ground cinnamon and a
pinch of salt and when I say a pinch I
mean like you know a generous pinch
because I like a little salt in there
and then process everything to combine
now what you want to do is just roll
your dough out to a 16 by 10 inch
rectangle spread with 4 tbsp of softened
unsalted butter then take the filling
and spread it out to cover the butter
and then press the filling into the
butter so that it sticks there when you
start rolling up your roll then roll
starting from one long end and rolling
up try to keep it nice and tight so the
filling stays inside the roll and
doesn't all out all over the place
that's it in a 9 by 13 inch baking dish
you can use a glass dish like this or a
small rimmed baking sheet either one
works cut your dough into 12 pieces and
you can use a knife or you can use a
bench scraper which is what I'm doing
take your rolls and place them with one
cut side down into the baking dish and
then cover them with plastic wrap and
let them rise till they're nice and
puffy that'll take about another hour
and 15 minutes haven't they changed a
lot look at that they're really really
puffy they're ready to bake 375 for
about 25 to 30 minutes these are baked
they just need to cool for a bit and
while they do I'm going to make a glaze
combined in a pot 1 cup of dark brown
sugar 6 tablespoons of unsalted butter
and 2 tablespoons of water you want to
melt everything together and then just
cook it a tiny bit like a minute or two
add a simmer so it thickens a little bit
to make a glaze
now after your buns have sat for about
15 minutes you can glaze them then you
just pour the glaze over the top these
are homemade
pecan buns from me to you
